data.title: Still serves up some great slices of pizza!
data.text: Rocky's is a special place for my wife & I.  Sure wish the place was a lot closer.  They have a a wide variety of pizza slices and they continue to take pride is serving pizza with good portions of toppings.  Salad bar and be hit or miss but tends to better stocked at lunch time.

data.title: Love, love, love the pizza
data.text: This Pizza restaurant is one of my favorites. I'll drive out of my way to eat here. I usually get their deep dish pizza but they do have a thin crust pizza on the menu as well. We had the meat lovers pizza during our last visit and it was fantastic. There was a generous amount of toppings and cheese. The bread sticks are amazing as well. This pizza store is definitely worth a try.

data.title: Pizza slice for lunch
data.text: What a great, great pizza! Stopped by for lunch today since it was close by to my errands today, hadn't been in a couple years since it isn't close to home. I used to go all the time in La Crosse WI. The deep dish pizza, sold by the slice, brought back great memories. It is just a unique, great pizza. I only wish there were more of these restaurants around the Minneapolis area.

data.title: YUM!!!
data.text: As good as all Rocky Rococos are! Our family stops at any of them when we do road trips since we don't have one in the area we live in. We lived in Onalaska, WI for years, and they have one there, and we really miss it. All four of us got super slices of pepperoni and sausage, and they all were perfect with lots of meat. We also couldn't pass up the bread sticks we love, and again.... they are as excellent here as other Rocky's. The service was good too.

data.title: Deep Dish Delight
data.text: Been coming to Rocky's forever,sadly there's only one left in Mn. Luckily for me I only live a few miles away, they serve the best deep dish pizza that I have tasted. Never have had to wait for a pick up order,at Valentines day they used to make a heart shaped pizza...super fun.

data.title: Best Pizza in Town
data.text: Not only is this the best Italian pizza. It's the only Rocky Rococo in our state. Our daughter and family had to move to North Carolina when our son-in-law had to transfer from here.  They usually come home 2x a year.  We have many of their favorite restaurants that the don't have in NC.  They try to go to some of their Minnesota favorites.  The one that they go to on any visit home is Rocky Rococo.  They came home for a long weekend this past June, we thought this would be the first time they didn't go.  I was wrong, on their last night we ended up at Rocky's.  This also our very favorite pizza place.  We don't go very often because it isn't close to our home, we do go at least 3x a year.

data.title: Nostalgic visit
data.text: Back in 1986 I was part of the first management team that opened this store, and it was fun to go back with my kids.  The pizza is the same as I remembered - deep thick crust pizza by the slice.  Unfortunately my two sons had to wait about ten minutes for their slices of pizza - which is why the review isn't excellent.  The pizza was good quality, the service friendly, and the kids liked the pizza.  Do not come here if you're looking for thin crust or crispy pizza - but Rocky's has probably the best thick pan crust around.  Their sauce is very tasty.  They specialize in pizza by the slice (each slice has about 500 - 600 calories, supersize slices a bit more), boxed up and ready to go.  They have a drive through so you can get your slices on the move.  I assume the wait for slices we experienced is not the norm, as that would undercut their niche.

data.title: Rocky's final outpost in Loon country!
data.text:
I don't normally review fast food or chain places, but I'm making an exception here. Rocky Rococo's is some darn good pizza. At one time there were dozens of these across the Twin cities, but this Brooklyn Park location is the last one left in Minnesota! It is a crying shame this delicious regional chain has only one location, but it is well worth the effort to seek it out and have a quick bite there. 

Don't let the outside fool you. I don't think it has had any attention since Rococo's glory days in the 1980s, but the inside is clean and inviting. Staff is friendly and efficient. Even on my visit at 4:00 in the afternoon, when I was the only customer, food was fresh hot and delicious. I had the sausage and peperoni super slice which I really enjoy. Rocky wisely chooses Coke products to pair with his excellent pan style pizza. 

Rocky's is a fast food restaurant, but has a better dining room than most. Carpet, quiet, clean, and almost cozy compared to most chains. Fine dining it is not, but if you desire a uniquely delicious slice of deep dish pizza with a salad bar salad, Rocky's can't be beat!

data.title: #1 Pizza
data.text: This is the best pizza ever. Period. The thick, golden crust topped with the delicious sauce, and the melts mozzarella and meaty sausage and pepperoni. This is that nostalgic pizza you remember from your childhood. Make the trip, you won't regret it.

data.title: What you expect from Rocky's!
data.text: YUM! My son and I ate  here on Saturday while driving home. We pulled off the highway to come here. We love Rocky's, but there isn't one anywhere around where we live. It was as good as we remembered, and the breadsticks were so fresh we could barely wait hold onto them. This is such an awesome place!

data.title: Poor service, okay food, slow food prep
data.text: I went with an excited friend for dinner.  I was not impressed with the dated quick service atmosphere.  The woman was slow, couldn't offer any assistance with the menu, and couldn't mentally divide our bill in two so we could each pay half.  (I helped her).  Then, the pizza we ordered took 45 minutes, and we had to go up and ask for it.  It wasn't very good pizza either.  I encouraged my friend to take all the leftovers, because I certainly didn't want them.  Save your self 35 minutes and $15, go to Little Caesars and order a deep dish, they're better.

data.title: Just like I always remembered!
data.text:
Some things never change! Growing up, I would frequently go for pizza at Rocky's with my family.  I always remembered how tasty the sausage pizza was, and I had a fond nostalgia for the unique pizza boxes and Rocky's logo.  At least 15 years have gone by since my hometown Rocky's closed, but Rocky's is just as good as I remembered:  same awesome sausage pizza, same kitschy decorations in the store, and same logo, boxes, and paper cups!  

All too often, the things we loved in childhood just don't measure up.  Rocky's still does, thank goodness!

data.title: You gotta go go, to this rocky rococo~~!!
data.text:
My dining experience started out with superior customer service, with associate Kenneth.  He made my visit delightful, and made me feel like a special guest.  The overall staff was ambitious, and the mood was (eager to please).  I asked about an additional, condiment side item, the shift manager Stacy was quick to fulfill my request.  Thumbs up team ~~!!  

That was a blast~~!!  8-24-13  Thanks~~!!

MIKE

data.title: Best Whole Wheat Crust Pizza
data.text: This Rocky Rococo pizza place is in the North Minneapolis Metro area at 7540 Brooklyn Blvd. It is located in Brooklyn Park, MN. They make a whole wheat crust pan pizza that tastes delicious. It is made in a square pan and my favorite is pepperoni. You can dine in or take out or a convenient drive thru. They have coupons in the store and there are daily specials excluding Sunday. They are open every day of the week. Check out their website for offers. Gotta try this pizza!

data.title: The best sausage pizza I've ever had in my life.
data.text: The best sausage pizza I've ever had in my life.

data.title: The last Rocky Rococo in...
data.text: The last Rocky Rococo in Minnesota.  I waited two years while I was in the Peace Corps to get this pizza and only periodically get it when I go back to visit family.  I've eaten New York style pizza in New York, Chicago style pizza in Chicago, pizza all over the world.  This is my favorite pizza, bar none.  If you ever have the opportunity, try this pizza.  The dough is slightly sweet, the sausage savory and with a slight tang of spice, the pepperoni large, the mushrooms, fresh.  Eat it with their cheesy bread.  Truly a diamond in the rough.

data.title: best pan pizza in the twin citys or any where else
data.text: best pan pizza in the twin citys or any where else
